item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "My tastes are simple: I am easily satisfied with the best." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "He had a dashing smile. It nearly dashed right off his face." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Ian Falconer
Elizabeth add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Rick Riordan
item.description: "Ever had a flying burrito hit you? Well, it's a deadly projectile, right up there with cannonballs and grenades." -- Rick Riordan

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Eating and reading are two pleasures that combine admirably." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Cut out all these exclamation points. An exclamation point is like laughing at your own joke." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Whether I shall turn out to be the hero of my own life, or whether that station will be held by anybody else, these pages must show." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "All endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The more I know of the world, the more I am convinced that I shall never see a man whom I can really love. I require so much!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by L. Frank Baum
item.description: "You have plenty of courage, I am sure," answered Oz. "All you need is confidence in yourself. There is no living thing that is not afraid when it faces danger. The true courage is in facing danger when you are afraid, and that kind of courage you have in plenty." -- L. Frank Baum

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation." "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by John August
item.description: "A little nonsense now and then, Is cherished by the wisest men." -- John August

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "You may be an undigested bit of beef, a blot of mustard, a crumb of cheese, a fragment of underdone potato. There's more of gravy than of grave about you, whatever you are!" -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Cornelia Funke
item.description: "Stories never really end...even if the books like to pretend they do. Stories always go on. They don't end on the last page, any more than they begin on the first page." -- Cornelia Funke

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
item.description: "Joy is the infallible sign of the presence of God." -- Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none" -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Elizabeth add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket
